page.title: 15HOUSING, BLEASDALE
page.content:
The majority of homes in Bleasdale are stonebuilt farmhouses with slate roofs.
Clough Head Cottages,were originally built as a Reformatory in 1857.It was self supporting having its own cultivated and pasture land.There were large workshops where the boys were taught useful trades.In 1905 the Reformatory was split up to form cottages for Bleasdale estate workers.
Brock Side is a wooden bungalow type house.It was originally a First World War army hut and brought to Bleasdale from Scotland.
Of the 28 properties 20 are owned by Bleasdale Estate,3 are rented,and 5 are owner-occupied.
